revised_title: The Life and Achievements of Sir Edward Frankland: A Pioneering Chemist
tldr: This book review explores the life and work of Sir Edward Frankland, a 19th-century chemist who made significant contributions to the fields of valency, organometallic chemistry, and water quality. The author highlights Frankland's unique personal story, including his illegitimacy and the challenges he faced in his early life, as well as the local environment and support system that helped shape his scientific career. The review also discusses the importance of Frankland's work in the broader context of 19th-century chemistry and science education.
